EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as the central storage depot.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) (with drop adjusted to (x=0.5, y=20.5)) for copper extraction.

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System)
Consists of the following entities:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) configured for automation research.
• Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) (currently flagged with fuel issues).
• Generator (Steam Engine) at (x=-0.5, y=24.5) with warnings about power network and fluid inputs.
• Offshore Pump at (x=-7.5, y=25.5) operating normally.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Two PipeGroups forming the fluid network at (x=-10.5, y=16.5), (x=-12.5, y=18.5), (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) running the copper-cable recipe.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for receiving copper plates.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) for dispatching copper-cable.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5) holding copper plates.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5) connecting production outputs.
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5) with defined pickup and drop positions.

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of the following entities:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) acting as the extraction storage.
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter – newly placed adjacent to the extraction chest at (x=-4.5, y=26.5) with its drop grid aligned to approximately (x=-4.0, y=26.0).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of the following entities and connection elements:
• Proposed Source – from the extraction system: Belt Source Inserter at (x=-4.5, y=26.5) with grid‐aligned drop at (x=-4.0, y=26.0).
• Provisional Target – an isolated Wooden Chest at (x=5.5, y=15.5) remaining as an intermediary.
• Final Target – originally intended as a wooden chest placement at (20.5, 10.5); after initial placement failures and obstruction issues, a new target chest was successfully placed at (x=20.5, y=10.5). In addition, at Step 245 a target inserter was added at (x=21.5, y=10.5) with its drop aligned to (x=20.5, y=10.5) to mediate the belt connection.
• Belt Route Attempts – initial waypoints were set to (x=0.0, y=26.0) and (x=0.0, y=10.0); later revised attempts introduced an alternate waypoint (x=-4.0, y=10.0).
• Note – Multiple belt connection attempts have failed due to issues including incorrect target entity type selection (direct targeting of a Prototype.SteamEngine), grid alignment errors in the path, and insufficient transport belt inventory.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Placement and Inventory Verification:
  - Ensure that the required item exists in the inventory before attempting placement.
  - Confirm that the intended placement area is free of obstructions; if an object exists in the target area, remove or relocate it prior to placement.

• Belt Connection Targeting:
  - Do not connect transport belts directly to powered entities such as Prototype.SteamEngine. Always interpose an inserter as the target to mediate item transfer.
  - Verify that the target entity variable (e.g. target_chest) is properly defined before use.

• Belt Path and Alignment:
  - Confirm that all intermediate waypoints are grid aligned and form a monotonic axis‐aligned path. Misaligned or fractional coordinates will trigger normalization errors.
  
• Transport Belt Inventory Checks:
  - Before connecting belt segments, ensure that the available inventory count of transport belts meets the required number.
  - If crafting fails due to missing sub-ingredients (for example, iron-plate required for transport-belt production), establish or verify that the necessary production facilities (smelter, crafting machine) are operational.

• Consistent Connection Strategy:
  - Use intermediary waypoints that avoid interference from other infrastructure (such as electrical poles or existing machines) especially during belt routing.
  - Maintain uniform entity types at both the source and target ends to avoid connection type conflicts.

• General API Usage:
  - Double-check API calls for proper parameter use and ensure that required existence checks (both inventory and map entities) are performed before operation.
